intro: Manihot peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a fibrous, starchy root system. It is often cultivated for its edible roots, which are used in cooking and as a thickening agent. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to humid, tropical climates.
